intro: Barkhausia divaricata, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white, fluffy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. Barkhausia divaricata is well adapted to the fynbos biome and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
